intro: Lepidagathis nematocephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in ecological and horticultural studies.
